meanings.definition: Experience a slight prickling or stinging sensation.
meanings.sent1: The thought of spiders sometimes tingles my skin.
meanings.sent2: When I touch the cactus, it tingles my fingers.
meanings.sent3: Tickling my brother always makes him tingle with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The excitement of the roller coaster ride tingles through my body.
meanings.sent5: The anticipation of the surprise gift tingles in my heart.

meanings.definition: Cause a sensation of slight prickling or stinging.
meanings.sent1: The cold wind tingles my cheeks.
meanings.sent2: The spicy food tingles my taste buds.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected twist in the movie tingles the audience with suspense.
meanings.sent4: The thrilling music tingles the crowd with excitement.
meanings.sent5: The romantic gesture tingles her senses with joy.

meanings.definition: A slight prickling or stinging sensation.
meanings.sent1: The tingle in my toes told me it was time to move.
meanings.sent2: The tingle on my skin made me shiver.
meanings.sent3: The tingle of excitement before the big game was palpable.
meanings.sent4: The tingle of fear crept up my spine.
meanings.sent5: The tingle of anticipation filled the room before the announcement.
